title: Heavy Equipment Operations Site
description: The operations site encompasses 125 acres and more than 45 machines.

title: IT Service Desk
description: Located in LEC B1032, the IT Service Desk assists Penn College students, faculty, and staff with a variety of computer issues.
body:
Most commonly, student employees can:

  • Troubleshoot and resolve issues with passwords and multifactor authentication (MFA)
  • Troubleshoot software and hardware problems
  • Resolve Internet connection issues (wired and wireless)
  • Install anti-virus and anti-spyware software
  • Identify causes of computer slowness and frequent errors
  • Answer general computer questions

Learn more about the IT Service Desk at myPCT.

title: Parking, Employee
description: Employee parking area.

title: Nature's Cove
description: Nature's Cove at the Earth Science Center offers made-to-order hot and cold sandwiches, entrees, salad, soda and snacks.

title: The Dr. Welch Workshop: A Makerspace at Penn College
description: Imagine a wide-open space where you can bring your boldest ideas to life. That’s the Makerspace. Located in the Carl Building Technologies Center, this creative environment is home to all types of equipment from 3D printers and sewing machines to mills and lathes.

title: Michael J. Hudock, Sr. Center for Academic Excellence
description: Located on the first floor of the Davie Jane Gilmour Center, the Center for Academic Excellence is the hub for student success resources.

title: ACC Auditorium
description: Located on the first floor of the Klump Academic Center, this 561-seat auditorium hosts special events and performances along with large-group presentations and all-college meetings.

title: The Centennial Mosaic
description: A mosaic created for Penn College’s Centennial by eight students and an instructor adorns a wall at the Physician Assistant Center on the main campus.
body:
The Centennial Mosaic, designed by David A. Stabley, instructor of ceramics and wood sculpture, is now complete on a wall of the Physician Assistant Center in the middle of campus. Measuring approximately 17 by 25 feet, the mosaic’s design relates to “social connectedness, paths travelled, dreams and the pleasure of learning through hands-on work,” according to Stabley.

Learn More

title: Motorcycle
description: A stainless-steel motorcycle sculpture at the north end of the campus mall.
body:
A stainless-steel motorcycle sculpture, courtesy of Pennsylvania College of Technology welding students, accentuates the north end of the campus mall. Members of the college’s American Welding Society club spent about six weeks fabricating the motorcycle. Famed metal artist Rae Ripple added her creative flair to the wheels during a campus visit in March.

Learn More

title: Penn's Inn
description: Located on the second floor of the Campus Center, this popular space is ideal for meetings and special events. A dance floor, stage lighting, and sound system accommodate both formal and informal activities.

title: Tutoring Services
description: Stay on course with the support of a tutor. Walk in and get support when you need it.

title: Flag
description: The 30-by-60-foot American flag atop a 120-foot flagpole.

title: Sawmill
description: The 8,000-square-foot sawmill houses lots of industry equipment like a dehumidification dry kiln, dozer, John Deere 440C skidder, CAT D3 skidder dozer, John Deer 380 forklift, and a 2011 tandem International logging truck with Prentice loader.

title: Clean Energy Center
description: The Clean Energy Center at Penn College is a nationally-recognized U.S. DOE legacy training center and BPI Test Center that provides training and technical assistance to home energy professionals, commercial building operators, government, utility companies, and other industry partners in the building performance field.

title: Center for Career Design
description: The Center for Career Design is a physical space and operation available on campus and virtually to bring students, alumni, and industry partners together for all things career-related.

title: Plastics Innovation & Resource Center
description: The Plastics Innovation & Resource Center (PIRC) provides technology resources to facilitate the growth and success of the plastics industry in the United States and throughout the world.

title: Student Bodies
description: Augmenting the campus mall, the large-scale project features 78 abstract human forms made of scrap-metal pieces welded together.

title: The Fish Real Estate Leadership Challenge Course
description: The 14,400-square-foot course was conceived and propelled by Rob Cooley, associate professor of anthropology and environmental science, who was inspired by transformational experiences among students in study-abroad expeditions and his Outdoor Recreation as a Therapeutic Tool course.

title: Dental Hygiene Clinic
description: The Dental Hygiene Program offered by the School of Nursing & Health Sciences at Pennsylvania College of Technology conducts a Dental Hygiene Clinic – open to the public – during the school year, typically September through April.

title: Penn Central
description: Penn Central features pizza-by-the-slice, grab-n-go salads, sandwiches, and entrees.

title: Keystone Dining Room
description: The Keystone Dining Room features breakfast from the grill, burgers, hot grilled sandwiches, home-style entrees, soups, made-to-order deli sandwiches, salad bar and more.

title: Capitol Eatery
description: This Residence Hall dining room features a variety of home-style entrees, daily concept bars, pizza, burgers and grilled sandwiches, fresh salads, homemade soups and more for breakfast, lunch or dinner.

title: Fuel
description: Your Residence Hall pit stop! Variety of quick snacks, cold beverages, grab-n-go sandwiches, salads and more.

title: Fresh2Go
description: Fresh2Go is a quick stop for grab-n-go sandwiches, salads, and drinks.

title: CC Commons
description: CC Commons offers made-to-order signature sandwiches, entrees and salads.

title: Wildcat Express

title: Bookmarks Cafe
description: Bookmarks Cafe serves freshly brewed gourmet coffees, teas, smoothies, grab-n-go sandwiches, soups, and fresh baked treats.

title: Schneebeli Earth Science Center
description: The "great outdoors" is a living laboratory at this beautiful campus. Academic programs offered here include Diesel Truck, Heavy Equipment & Power Generation; Forestry; Heavy Equipment Operations; and Landscape/Plant Production.
body:
Constructed in 1971 (Sawmill and River sites acquired and built upon between 1975–87); 49,966 Building Gross Square Footage; 358.34 Acres

The "great outdoors" is a living laboratory at this beautiful campus. Academic programs offered here include Diesel Truck, Heavy Equipment & Power Generation; Forestry; Heavy Equipment Operations; and Landscape/Plant Production.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site (off the main campus) include:

  • Energy Technology Education Center
  • Industrial Technology & Trade Skills
  • Personal Enrichment

Located approximately 12 miles south of Williamsport, just off Route 15.

Contact Information

Earth Science Center

  • 570-320-8038
  • 570.547.6352 (FAX)
  • Mailing Address: Pennsylvania College of Technology
  • DIF #165
  • One College Avenue
  • Williamsport, PA 17701

Energy Technology Education Center

  • 570-327-4775
  • Mailing Address: Shale Training & Education Center
  • DIF #29
  • One College Avenue
  • Williamsport, PA 17701

Directions

If you are using a GPS or mapping service, use

  • 130 Allenwood Camp Ln., Montgomery, PA 17752 for directions to the Energy Technology Education Center
  • 203 Allenwood Camp Ln., Montgomery, PA 17752 for directions to the Earth Science Center


Map (above) indicates Schneebeli Earth Science Center (ESC) and Energy Technology Education Center (ETEC) locations.

title: Penn College at Wellsboro
description: Penn College at Wellsboro services Northern Tier business and industry training needs, as well as noncredit personal and professional development.

title: Kathryn Wentzel Lumley Aviation Center
description: The Aviation Center is home to the FAA and Transport certified aircraft repair and maintenance programs.
body:
The Aviation Center is home to the FAA and Transport certified aircraft repair and maintenance programs. Specialized labs and coursework cover airframe, power-plant and avionics repair.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site (off the main campus) include:

  • General Computing & Networking Technology
  • Microsoft Office
  • Textron Lycoming

Constructed in 1992 with 50,000 Gross Square Footage on 5.80 acres, this magnificent $6 million facility, located at the Williamsport Regional Airport, was opened in 1993 to provide instruction in aviation and avionics related programming.

The Aviation Center is approximately seven miles east of Williamsport and is easily accessible from Route 220/180.

Contact Information

  • 570-326-3761, ext. 3629
  • 570.368.8325 (FAX)
  • Mailing Address: Pennsylvania College of Technology
  • DIF #158
  • One College Avenue
  • Williamsport, PA 17701

Directions

If you are using a GPS or mapping service, use 500 Airport Rd., Montoursville, PA 17754 for directions.


Map (above) indicates Wentzel Lumley Aviation Center location.

title: Community Arts Center
description: Music, Dance, Broadway, Theater, Comedy, Family Entertainment

title: Advanced Automotive Technology Center
description: The AATC houses the upper divisional course work in automotive including alternative powered vehicles and the motorsports program.

title: General Services
description: General Services, Clean Energy Center, procurement services, and shipping & receiving.

title: Le Jeune Chef Restaurant
description: Le Jeune Chef (translated "the young chef") Restaurant, on the campus of Pennsylvania College of Technology in Williamsport, presents a fine-dining experience hosted by the College’s School of Business & Hospitality.

title: Kenneth E. Carl Building Technologies Center
description: The Building Technologies Center is home to our School of Engineering Technologies' Building Construction programs and The Dr. Welch Workshop: A Makerspace at Penn College. Along with faculty offices, the center houses large carpentry; plumbing; and heating, ventilation, and air conditioning labs. The labs are used for training students when they're not working at a site.
body:
Constructed in 1980
109,096 Gross Square Footage

The Building Technologies Center is home to our School of Engineering Technologies' Building Construction programs and The Dr. Welch Workshop: A Makerspace at Penn College. Along with faculty offices, the center houses large carpentry; plumbing; and heating, ventilation, and air conditioning labs. The labs are used for training students when they're not working at a site.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • Industrial Technology & Trade Skills

The Building Technologies Center is adjacent to the Lifelong Education Center.

title: Hager Lifelong Education Center
description: Penn College’s Hager Lifelong Education Center is home to our School of Engineering Technologies, as well as various labs for biology, chemistry, drafting and CAD, and cooking.
body:
Constructed in 1984
84,026 Gross Square Footage

Penn College's Hager Lifelong Education Center is home to our School Engineering Technologies, as well as various labs for biology, chemistry, architecture, construction management, baking, culinary arts, and human services & restorative justice. The building also houses Athletics , Le Jeune Chef Restaurant (Penn College’s student-operated casual-fine dining facility), the Robert & Maureen Dunham Childrens' Learning Center, Keystone Dining Room, Penn Central, the IT Service Desk, and the ID Center.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • AutoCAD
  • Personal Enrichment

title: Lewis H. Bardo Gymnasium
description: The Bardo Gymnasium hosts numerous physical education classes. The building is also home for our Wildcat baseball, volleyball , and wrestling teams, as well as intramural and club sports.
body:
Constructed in 1939
38,352 Gross Square Footage

Bardo Gymnasium has a seating capacity of 1,500. In addition to being used for intramural and club sports and numerous fitness classes, Bardo Gym is home to Wildcat basketball, volleyball, and wrestling. The court is located on the second floor and is accessible by four different stairwells and an elevator. Locker rooms for teams and officials are located on the first floor in addition to a full training room. Parking is located across the street and adjacent to the building.

title: Automotive Engine Repair Center
description: The ERC houses the labs, rooms, and faculty offices for the School of Transportation & Natural Resources Technologies major engine overhauls.
body:
Constructed in 1931–42

This building houses the labs, rooms, and faculty offices for the School of Engineering Technologies' Major Engine Overhauls.

title: Physician Assistant Center
description: This newly renovated space dedicated to Penn College Physician Assistant students features a tiered classroom, a cadaver lab where students perform the entire dissection from start-to-finish, and multiple simulation labs designed to complement each of the program’s seven core clinical rotations.
body:
This building also houses state-of-the art learning resources that allow students to convert classroom theory into hands-on application. Here are just a few of the resources offered:

  • Three high-fidelity patient simulators (pediatric, obstetric, and multipurpose adult)
  • Multiple low-fidelity manikins and skill trainers in varying skin tones in support of DEI
  • Laparoscopic trainers
  • Point-of-care ultrasound
  • Mock EHR platform and telehealth stations

More about Penn College's Physician Assistant program

title: Electrical Technologies Center
description: This building houses the labs and rooms for the School of Engineering Technologies Electrical programs.
body:
Constructed in 1931–42

This building houses the labs and rooms for the School of Engineering Technologies' Electrical programs.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • Industrial Technology & Trade Skills

description: This building houses the labs and rooms for the School of Engineering Technologies Machine Tool Technologies.
body:
Constructed in 1931-42

This building houses the labs and rooms for the School Engineering Technologies' Automated Manufacturing & Machining programs.

title: Lycoming Engines Metal Trades Center
description: The building houses the tool and die making, metal trades, and welding labs along with various rooms.
body:
Constructed in 1980
26,802 Gross Square Footage

The building houses the tool and die making, metal trades, and welding labs along with various faculty offices and rooms.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • Industrial Technology & Trade Skills

title: George S. Klump Academic Center
description: The upper-level floors are used by the School of Business, Arts, and Sciences and School of Engineering Technologies. The lower-level floor houses Workforce Development's Paramedic Science program.
body:
Constructed in 1913–14
Renovated Entire Building in 2004
Renovated Fourth Floor in 2024
133,810 Gross Square Footage

The second and third floors are used by the School of Business, Arts & Sciences, with the brand new School of Engineering Technologies' Architecture Suite on the fourth floor.

The lower-level floor houses the Workforce Development's Paramedic Technology program.

The first two floors house our auditorium, as well as various faculty and staff offices. Among the offices are the School of Business, Arts & Sciences and Tutoring Services.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development in this building include:

  • Business & Management
  • Health Sciences
  • Industrial Technology & Trade Skills
  • Personal Enrichment
An Historical Look at the ACC

Time Will Explain It All: A Look Into The Past And Future Through Voices And Images

title: Center for Business & Workforce Development
description: The Center for Business and Workforce Development is the home for: Pennsylvania College of Technology – Workforce Development, Pennsylvania College of Technology – Electronics and Computer Engineering Technologies, IMC, Keystone Innovation Zone
body:
Constructed in 2006-07
31,800 Gross Square Footage

The Center for Business and Workforce Development is the home for:

  • Pennsylvania College of Technology – Workforce Development
  • Pennsylvania College of Technology – The Apprenticeship Center
  • Pennsylvania College of Technology – Electronics & Computer Engineering Technologies
  • IMC 
  • Penn State Marcellus Center for Outreach and Research

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • Development Needs Assessment (DNA)
  • Business/Leadership
  • Apprenticeships
  • Industrial
  • Computer Skills
  • Plastics
  • Healthcare
  • Transportation
  • Sustainability

Directions

From the North: From U.S. Routes 14 and 15 South, follow U.S. Route 15 South to Williamsport and take the Maynard Street Exit.

From the South: Follow U.S. Route 15 North to Williamsport and take the Maynard Street Exit.

From the East: Follow Interstate 80 to Interstate 180/Route 220 (exit 212W). Continue on Interstate 180/Route 220 to Williamsport and take the Maynard Street Exit.

From the West: Follow Interstate 80 to Route 220 (exit 178). Follow Route 220 North to Williamsport and take the Maynard Street Exit.

All Traffic: From the Maynard Street Exit, travel North on Maynard Street. Continue North on Maynard Street past the main entrance to the College and through the West Third Street traffic light. At the end of Maynard Street, turn left onto West Fourth Street. Follow West Fourth Street for .4 miles (approximately two to three blocks). The Center for Business & Workforce Development will be located on your left. (A black fence surrounds the parking lot and building.)

If you are using a GPS or mapping service, use 1127 W. Fourth St., Williamsport, PA 17701 for directions.

PENN COLLEGE AT WELLSBORO DIRECTIONS

If you are using a GPS or mapping service, use 12880 Route 6, Wellsboro, PA 16910 for directions.
View on Campus Map

title: Construction Masonry Building
description: The single-story Construction Masonry Building features a large, open lab area and reflects the latest in "green" technologies.
body:
Constructed in 2011
18,500 Gross Square Footage

The single-story Construction Masonry Building features a large, open lab area and reflects the latest in "green" technologies. Skills in stone masonry and brick and block masonry are practiced in the lab, along with fireplace construction competencies.

More about Penn College's Building Construction program

title: Police Office
description: The Police Department at Pennsylvania College of Technology serves the Penn College community by ensuring the health, safety, and welfare of the student body, faculty and staff, and visitors to the College's campuses, while securing the campus itself, and all College facilities.

title: College Avenue Labs
description: The CAL building houses faculty offices Automated Manufacturing, Civil Engineering & Surveying, Collision Repair & Restoration and, Engineering & Industrial Design programs.
body:
This building, along West Third Street, opened in Fall 2003 and houses faculty offices and the following programs:

  • Automated Manufacturing
  • Civil Engineering & Surveying
  • Collision Repair & Restoration
  • Engineering & Industrial Design

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • AutoCAD
  • Business & Management
  • Health Sciences
  • Industrial Technology & Trade Skills
  • Personal Enrichment

description: These halls offer a variety of living environments including 2-bedroom (2 people per bedroom) apartments, 1-bedroom (2 people per apartment) apartments, and efficiency (2 people in 1 large room) apartments within a gated community.

title: Dauphin Hall
description: This six-hall facility offers new, first-year students various living arrangements, including apartment-style units and traditional-style residential units.
body: This six-hall facility offers new, first-year students various living arrangements, including apartment-style units and traditional-style residential units.

title: George H. Parkes Automotive Technology Center
description: The ATC houses our School of Transportation & Natural Resources Technologies, with nine automotive labs.
body:
Constructed in 1970
41,326 Gross Square Footage

The Automotive Technology Center houses faculty offices and automotive labs, including:

  • Pre-State Inspection
  • Brakes/Steering & Suspension
  • Manual Transmission/Air Conditioning
  • Electrical and Fuel
  • Brakes/industry
  • Engine/transmission
  • Engine performance
  • Accessory repair
  • Honda PACT

title: John F. Thompson Professional Development Center
description: The PDC is an excellent setting for all your special events, from meetings, conferences, and seminars to management retreats, parties, and wedding receptions.

title: Victorian House
description: The Victorian House hosts special guests to campus – including visiting chefs, lecturers, and prominent figures – for overnight stays.
body:
The Victorian House at Pennsylvania College of Technology was dedicated on June 14, 1997, after more than two years of work by students, faculty, and staff. It was renovated in the summer of 2014, with updates to the guest rooms, rotunda, and exterior.

The Victorian House hosts special guests to campus – including visiting chefs, lecturers, and prominent figures – for overnight stays. It is also used to host various events dedicated to growing Penn College's student scholarship fund.

Learn More

title: Robert L. Breuder Advanced Technology & Health Sciences Center
description: The ATHS houses classes for the School of Engineering Technologies, School of Business & Hospitality, and School of Nursing & Health Sciences.
body:
Constructed in 1986
152,817 Gross Square Footage

The ATHS houses classes for the School & Engineering Technologies' Information Technology and Plastics & Polymer Engineering Technology programs (east wing), the School of Business, Arts & Sciences' Accounting & Business Administration programs (east wing); and School of Nursing & Health Sciences (west wing).

The building also contains Fresh2Go and offices for the School of Nursing & Health Sciences, Plastics Innovation & Resource Center, Printing & Document Services, and Mail Services Center.

Noncredit programs and services offered by Workforce Development on this site include:

  • Business & Management
  • Health Sciences
  • Personal Enrichment
  • Plastics

title: Hyner View, Bald Eagle, Tiadaghton Halls
description: Hyner View, Bald Eagle, Tiadaghton Hall, part of the Campus View Apartments complex.

title: Little Pine
description: Little Pine Hall, part of the Campus View Apartments complex.

title: Black Forest, Millbrook, Ole Bull
description: Little Pine hall is part of the Campus View Apartments complex.

title: Alvin C. Bush Campus Center
description: The CC is home to The College Store, Student Activities, Athletics, Counseling Services, Career Services, College Health Services, Penns Inn, the Fitness Center,and various Dining Services operations.
body: The Campus Center is home to art studios, various classrooms, the College Store , Student Affairs, Office of Student Engagement, Counseling Services, Disability & Access Resources, College Health Services, Penn's Inn, Fitness Center, Student Information Desk, Student Organization & Leadership Center, study areas and lounge, fire pit patio, Wildcat Express convenience store and CC Commons dining.

title: Madigan Library
description: The 1,000 seat Madigan Library opened in August 2006. The Library features media facilities, individual and group study areas, Bookmarks Cafe, Art Gallery, outdoor reading area, and archives.
body:
Constructed in 2005-06
Dedication: Sept. 12, 2006
104,000 Gross Square Footage

The 1,000 seat Madigan Library opened in August 2006. The Library features media facilities, individual and group study areas, Bookmarks Cafe, The Gallery at Penn College, ESPORTS , an outdoor reading area, and archives. The Library is also home to College Relations, the Penn College Foundation, and the Center for Career Design, comprised of Alumni Relations, Career Services, and Corporate Relations.

The Library also features various computing resources, including:

  • 42 research computers in the reference area
  • 8 look-up stations
  • 100-seat open computer lab complex
  • (2) 30-seat instructional computer rooms
  • VR studio
  • Wildcat Wireless Zone (including outdoor reading area)

Learn More

title: Army ROTC
description: Army ROTC prepares college students pursuing a baccalaureate degree for military service as commissioned officers in the active Army, or part-time in the Army Reserve or Army National Guard.
body:
The Army ROTC is a renowned leadership program designed to enhance your college experience and prepare you for military service as a commissioned officer in the active Army or part-time in the Army Reserve or Army National Guard.

Learn More

title: Field House
description: The FH is a practice and competition arena for the Penn College Wildcat athletic teams.
body:
Building Information

Constructed in 1999

Built by students in programs now part of the School of Engineering Technologies, the Field House is the hub of campus recreation. It is equipped with two basketball courts, table tennis tables, and equipment students can sign-out. The Field House hosts intramural sports, club sports, open recreation, and is also used for various student engagement functions.

Intramural Activities

There are over 30 intramural activities offered throughout the academic year. Aside from the traditional intramural activities such as dodgeball, basketball, and volleyball, non-active Intramural events include cornhole, washers, horseshoes, and fantasy football leagues.

Outdoor Recreation Equipment

Students can sign out tents, lanterns, chairs, and other outdoor recreational equipment for camping or hiking.

Outdoor Facilities

Adjacent to the Field House are the outdoor basketball courts, tennis courts, horseshoe pits, intramural field, and UPMC Field.

title: Davie Jane Gilmour Center
description: The first floor houses offices for Admissions, the Center for Academic Success, K-12 Outreach, Registrar, Financial Aid, and the Major General Fred F. Marty Veterans and Military Resource Center.
body:
Constructed in 2002. 78,800 Gross Square Footage.

The first floor houses offices for Admissions, the Center for Academic Excellence, K-12 Outreach, Registrar, Financial Aid, and the Major General Fred F. Marty Veterans and Military Resource Center.

The second floor houses the offices for Educational Emerging Technologies, Bursar, Information Technology Services, People & Culture, and Financial Operations.

The third floor houses administrative offices, including the offices of the President, Academic Affairs, Public Relations & Marketing, and other senior administrators.
